children.name: be against
children.definition: to think that sth is wrong and that it should not be allowed: chống lại/ phản đối
examples: Lundgren is against abortion.

children.name: be dead set againstbe very much against something
examples: She wants to marry him, but her parents are dead set against it.

children.name: oppose
children.definition: to think that a plan, idea etc is wrong, and to try to prevent it from happening or succeeding: chống đối, phản đối
examples: Conservative MPs say they will oppose the new bill.

children.name: strongly/vigorously oppose
examples: The Church strongly opposes same-sex marriage.

children.name: not agree with
children.definition: sthespecially spoken to be against sth, for example because it is new or different and you do not like things to change: không đồng tình
examples: My grandmother doesn’t agree with divorce.
There are many people in the US who do not agree with capital punishment.

children.name: not believe in
children.definition: sthto not support something, because you think something is wrong or immoral: không ủng hộ
examples: Fiona doesn’t believe in having sex before marriage.
I don’t believe in hitting children for any reason.

children.name: anti-
children.definition: chống lại

children.name: anti-war/-smoking/-American etc : chống chiến tranh/đế quốc/Mỹ
examples: against war, smoking, America etc:
▪ Anti-war demonstrators gathered in the city’s main square.

children.name: Những người biểu tình chống chiến tranh tụ họp ở quãng trường trung tâm thành phố
examples: ▪ The anti-smoking laws seem ridiculous to me.

children.name: đối với tôi luật cấm hút thuốc thật lố bịch
examples: ▪ Anti-American sentiment remains high in the region.

children.name: Quan điểm chống Mỹ vẫn tiếp tục duy trì ở vùng này
hostile
children.definition: sb who is hostile to a plan or idea opposes it very strongly, and expresses this in an angry way: chống đối
examples: A hostile audience refused to listen to Senator Drummond’s reply.

children.name: hostile to/towards
examples: Local people are hostile towards the plan, which would involve a significant tax increase.

children.name: openly hostileshowing very clearly that you are hostile chống đối công khai
examples: Lydon was openly hostile to any kind of criticism of the project.

children.name: antagonistic
children.definition: behaving in a way that shows that you strongly disapprove of sb or sth: đối lập
examples: A lot of people refuse to work with Paula. Her manner is just too antagonistic.

children.name: antagonistic to/towards
examples: The right-wing press has always been deeply antagonistic towards the Labour party.

children.name: be opposed to
children.definition: to think that sth is wrong and that it should not be allowed: chống lại/ phản đối
examples: Most people are opposed to the privatization of the city’s public transportation system.

children.name: be strongly/totally/opposed to
examples: Senator Thompson remains totally opposed to any form of gun control.

children.name: a person or group that opposes sth
opponent
children.definition: a person or group that opposes sth: kẻ phản đối

children.name: opponent of
examples: In some countries, any opponent of the government is likely to lose their job.
One notable opponent of the proposal was the mayor.

children.name: the opposition
children.definition: a group that is opposing another group, especially the political party or parties whose elected representatives oppose the official government: phe đối lập
examples: ▪ Opinion polls showed the opposition pulling ahead in some areas.
▪ Newspapers must reflect the views of the opposition as well as those of the government.

children.name: enemy
children.definition: a person or group that opposes something very strongly and tries to stop it or destroy it - used especially when you disapprove of this person or group:
examples: enemy of :
the enemies of democracy
an enemy of the Jewish people
the enemy of sth[literary : sth that harms sth else]
Familiarity is the enemy of desire.

children.name: to say sth to show that you oppose sth
object
children.definition: to say sth to show that you oppose a plan or action because you think it is unfair or morally wrong: phản đối
examples: His supporters will certainly object if he is fired.

children.name: object to
examples: Rebecca objects to being told what to do.

children.name: strongly object to
examples: The committee strongly objected to the report’s recommendations.

children.name: raise objections
children.definition: to give specific reasons for opposing a plan or action: phản đối
examples: None of the committee members raised any objections, so we took a vote.

children.name: raise objections to
examples: Several church members raised objections to the way the money had been spent.

children.name: words or behaviour that show that you oppose sth
objection
children.definition: a reason that you have for opposing or disapproving of sth, or sth you say that expresses this: phản đối
examples: Her objection was that he was too young.
COMMON ERRORS
►Do not say 'say an objection'. Saymake an objection.

children.name: have an objection
examples: Does anyone have any objections to the proposal?

children.name: make an objection
children.definition: say what your objection is
examples: The Parish Council made several objections to the changes.

children.name: raise/voice an objection
children.definition: make an objection
examples: His father raised no objections when John told him that he wanted to become a dancer.

children.name: meet sb’s objections
children.definition: change something so that someone will no longer object
examples: He altered the plans to meet the objections of community leaders.

children.name: withdraw an objection
children.definition: stop objecting to something
examples: The FBI withdrew its objections to publishing the information.

children.name: lodge an objection
children.definition: formally make an objection
examples: Residents have lodged an objection to the new development.

children.name: a strong objection
examples: Parents at the school have voiced strong objections to the closure.

children.name: a serious/major objection
examples: There were serious objections to using the videotaped evidence at the trial.

children.name: the main objection
examples: One of the main objections was that classes were being taught by untrained staff.

children.name: a fundamental objection
examples: A fundamental objection is that the church should not be part of the government.

children.name: a moral objection
examples: He has expressed moral objections to this type of research.

children.name: a religious objection
examples: Roman Catholics have religious objections to the use of contraceptives.

children.definition: a
examples: conscientious objection(= the fact of refusing to become a solider because of your moral or religious beliefs )Conscientious objection to military service is seen by the United Nations as part of your right to freedom of thought.

children.name: objection to
examples: He had moral objections to killing animals for food.

children.name: over the objections of sb(= in spite of their objections )
examples: The bill was passed over the objections of many Democrats.

children.name: opposition
children.definition: things that people say or do in order to show that they are against sth: sự phản đối
examples: Widespread opposition to the military government led to violence in the streets.

children.name: strong opposition
children.definition: disagreement that someone feels strongly
examples: The scheme has met with strong opposition from local people.

children.name: fierce/intense/stiff opposition
children.definition: strong opposition
examples: It is certain that there will be fierce opposition to the changes.

children.name: violent/vehement opposition
children.definition: showing extremely strong angry feelings
examples: The 2,000-strong congress met the violent opposition of left-wingers.|There has been vehement opposition from the fishing industry.

children.name: considerable opposition
children.definition: quite a lot of opposition
examples: The development went ahead in spite of considerable opposition.

children.name: growing/mounting opposition
children.definition: opposition that is increasing
examples: There was growing opposition to the war.

children.name: local opposition
examples: It took three years to overcome local opposition from environmentalists.

children.name: widespread opposition
children.definition: opposition from many people or in many places
examples: Journalists have reported widespread opposition to the regime.

children.name: public opposition
examples: Public opposition has blocked the building of nuclear power stations.

children.name: organized opposition
children.definition: protest that people express by working together in an organized way
examples: The proposal was passed with no organized opposition.

children.name: face opposition
children.definition: experience opposition that has to be dealt with
examples: The proposal faced opposition from road safety campaigners.

children.name: meet
children.definition: with
examples: opposition/run into opposition(= face opposition )A new tax would meet a lot of opposition.|The Bill ran into opposition in the House of Lords.

children.name: encounter opposition
children.definition: find that there is opposition
examples: The police encountered little opposition, and restored order within the hour.

children.name: express
children.definition: your
examples: oppositionParents expressed their opposition to the tests.

children.name: overcome opposition
children.definition: deal with opposition so that it no longer exists
examples: Nothing he said could overcome their opposition.

children.name: arouse opposition/arouse the opposition of sb
children.definition: make someone feel disagreement
examples: A plan to build on farm land aroused local opposition.

children.name: opposition comes from sb
examples: The strongest opposition came from Republican voters.

children.name: opposition to
examples: Opposition to the war grew rapidly:
There was a great deal of opposition to the war.

children.name: opposition from
examples: Theyface oppositionfrom local residents as well as from environmentalists.

children.name: hostility
children.definition: angry remarks or behaviour that shows sb opposes a plan or idea very strongly: sự chống đối
examples: The reform program was greeted with hostility by conservatives.
The announcement was greeted with hostility from some employees.
hostility to/towards
There is a lot of public hostility to the tax.
Pictures of refugees arousedpopular hostility(= felt by a lot of people )towards the war.
Republican hostility toward slavery
open hostilityobvious or public hostility
Given his open hostility, it seemed pointless to try and continue to persuade him.

children.name: antagonism
children.definition: angry and unpleasant feelings or behaviour that show sb dislikes or disagrees very strongly with a person, organization, plan, or idea: phản kháng

children.name: antagonism to/towards
examples: Hines made no effort to conceal his antagonism towards his supervisor.

children.name: antagonism between: sự phản kháng giữa
examples: Mitchell sees no clear way to end the antagonism between the two groups.

children.name: contrary
children.definition: adjectiveOPPOSITEđối lập
examples: opposite
_a contrary point of view
_Contrarytoall our expectations, he's found a well-paid job and a nice girlfriend.
_contrary beliefs
những tín ngưỡng trái ngược
-traffic moving in contrary directions
xe cộ di chuyển theo nhiều hướng ngược nhau
_contrary winds
gió ngược
_"unlucky" and "lucky" are contrary terms
'xui' và 'hên' là những từ trái ngược nhau (trái nghĩa với nhau)

children.name: versus
children.definition: prepositionchống, chống lại, đấu với
examples: used to compare two things or ideas, especially when you have to choose between them
_private education versus state education

children.name: stand
children.definition: nounOPPOSITIONsự chống cự, sự đấu tranh chống lại, sự kháng cự
examples: [ C usually singular ] an act of opposition, especially in defence
_Environmental groups aremaking astandagainstthe new road through the valley.
_to make a stand against the enemy chống cự lại quân địch
_a stand of sixty days cuộc cầm cự sáu mươi ngày
_the rebel's last stand đợt kháng cự cuối cùng của quân nổi loạn

children.name: counter
children.definition: adverbđối lập, chống lại, trái lại, ngược lại
examples: in a way that opposes
_Bob's decision not to take the jobrancountertohis family's expectations.
_to act counter to someone's wishes
hành động chống lại ý muốn của một người nào
_to go counter
đi ngược lại, làm trái lại

children.name: have sth against sb
children.definition: havesthagainstsb

children.name: If you have something against someone, you dislike them for a reason
examples: _I'venothingagainst him - I just don't have much in common with him.
